dialog

Class DialogNode

  • java.lang.Object
    • dialog.DialogNode

  • public class DialogNode
extends java.lang.Object
    Node data structure for implementing dialog graphs.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Mark Groeneveld

    • Constructor Detail

      • DialogNode

        public DialogNode(boolean isNPC,
          java.lang.String text,
          java.util.ArrayList<double[]> probSets,
          DialogNode[] children)
        Constructs and initializes a DialogNode.
        Parameters:
        isNPC - Is this node spoken by an NPC (Non-Playable Character)?
        text - Text to be spoken The unique string "initial" indicates a dialog's starting node. This node will not be spoken, but leads to one or more other nodes which are.
        probSets - Map of probabilities the NPC uses to select a response There may be multiple arrays corresponding to different strategies. Array index is the strategy number. Each array should sum to 1.0 and should be of same length as children. Each probability set is also described as this node's row of the discrete time Markov chain's transition matrix, the part of which is nonzero for all strategies. An empty array indicates no probability set. Do not use a null object.
        children - Array of children nodes If children is empty this is an end node.
